tldr: Q2 FY2025 revenue grew 9% to $25.0B with strong AI server demand and ISG growth of 38%, while gross margin compressed on AI mix and pricing. Dell raised FY2025 guidance to $95.5B-$98.5B revenue and $7.80 +/- $0.25 EPS, and guided Q3 revenue of $24.0B-$25.0B with EPS of $2.00 +/- $0.10.
bullets: Revenue rose 9% to $25.0B and diluted EPS increased 9% to $1.89; ISG revenue surged 38% to $11.6B.
AI orders were $3.2B with $3.1B of shipments and $3.8B backlog; pipeline expanded across CSPs and enterprise.
FY2025 guide lifted to $95.5B-$98.5B revenue and $7.80 +/- $0.25 EPS; Q3 revenue $24.0B-$25.0B and EPS $2.00 +/- $0.10.

segments.title: Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG)
points: Revenue grew 38% to $11.6B; server and networking revenue rose 80% to $7.7B.
Storage revenue declined 5% to $4.0B despite double-digit demand in Dell IP storage.
Operating income increased 22% to $1.3B with margin improving to 11%.

segments.title: Client Solutions Group (CSG)
points: Revenue fell 4% to $12.4B; commercial was flat at $10.6B while consumer declined 22%.
Operating income was $767M (6.2% margin) amid competitive pricing.

segments.title: AI servers and pipeline
points: AI orders were $3.2B and shipments were $3.1B, with backlog at $3.8B.
Pipeline expanded again and remained multiple of backlog, with growing enterprise adoption.

notes.title: Cost actions
points: Operating expense declined 4% and included a $328M workforce reduction charge.
Dell continues to target low-single-digit OpEx declines for FY2025.

notes.title: Capital return
points: Returned $1.0B to shareholders and paid down $1.0B of net debt in Q2.
Repurchased 5.5M shares at $130.03 and paid a $0.45 dividend.

themes.title: ISG margin expansion
points: Storage mix shifted toward Dell IP with improved pricing discipline.
AI server profitability improved via engineering value and services attach.

themes.title: AI shipment timing
points: Q3 guidance embeds lower AI shipments sequentially based on GPU availability and customer readiness.
Pipeline and enterprise demand continue to expand.

top_questions.question: What drove the 300 bps sequential jump in ISG margin?
top_questions.summary: Higher server revenue scale, improved storage mix toward Dell IP, and better AI profitability.

top_questions.question: Why is AI revenue expected to be down sequentially in Q3?
top_questions.summary: Guidance reflects GPU availability and customer delivery timing; pipeline remains multiple of backlog.

top_questions.question: When does the PC refresh accelerate?
top_questions.summary: Management expects a second-half pickup, with Windows 10 end-of-life and aging installed base as catalysts.

implications: Rising Dell IP storage mix improves ISG margin resilience despite AI mix pressure.
Enterprise and sovereign AI pipeline growth broadens customer mix beyond Tier 2 CSPs.
competitive_notes: Pricing remains tight in CSG and large enterprise server bids.
forecast_hooks: Track Q3 AI shipment timing versus backlog and pipeline growth.
Monitor storage revenue inflection as Dell IP demand gains scale.
Watch PC refresh indicators into Q4.

action_items: Validate enterprise AI attach rates for storage and services.
Assess Dell IP storage share gains against partner IP declines.
open_questions: How quickly can AI shipment timing improve as Blackwell supply ramps?
Will CSG recovery skew more toward Q4 than prior expectations?
watch_next_quarter: Q3 ISG margin progression toward the 11%-14% framework.
AI backlog trajectory versus the $3.8B baseline.
